event.title: January 1852 the name of Nelson was adopted

data.event: In January 1852 the name of Nelson was adopted for the settlement, after the ship Lady Nelson, which was used by Lieutenant James Grant in explorations of the area in the early nineteenth century.

event.title: was built across the river in 1848

data.event: A punt was built across the river in 1848 by Henry Kellett.
A summerhouse was also built in 1848, which later became the town's current hotel.
The town site was surveyed and named in 1852 by Lindsay Clarke, and sheep grazing began soon after.

event.title: was constructed out of wood in 1893

data.event: The first crossing over the Glenelg was constructed out of wood in 1893.

event.title: was replaced by the current steel cantilever bridge in 1963

data.event: It was replaced by the current steel cantilever bridge in 1963.
